intro: Senecio obscurus, commonly known as the dark senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Senecio obscurus is a perennial shrub that can reach up to 1 meter in height.
